Class Board

java.lang.Object
gameLogic.Board
public class Board extends Object
Represents a 4x4 Quarto board. The board stores pieces placed on the fields and provides methods to query and update the board state. A field is empty if it contains null.

      public static final int DIM
      See Also:
      • Constant Field Values

  • Constructor Details

    • Board

      public Board()
      Constructs an empty 4x4 board. All fields are initially empty.

  • Method Details

    • deepCopy

      public Board deepCopy()
      Creates a copy of this board. The pieces themselves are not copied, as they are immutable.
      Returns:
      a copy of this board

    • index

      public int index(int row, int col)
      Converts a (row, col) pair to a linear index.
      Parameters:
      row - the row index
      col - the column index
      Returns:
      the corresponding linear index

    • isField

      public boolean isField(int index)
      Checks whether an index refers to a valid board field.
      Parameters:
      index - the index to check
      Returns:
      true if the index is valid

    • isField

      public boolean isField(int row, int col)
      Checks whether a (row, col) pair refers to a valid board field.
      Parameters:
      row - the row index
      col - the column index
      Returns:
      true if the pair is valid

    • getField

      public Piece getField(int i)
      Returns the piece stored at the given index.
      Parameters:
      i - the field index
      Returns:
      the piece on the field, or null if the field is empty

    • getField

      public Piece getField(int row, int col)
      Returns the piece stored at the given (row, col) position.
      Parameters:
      row - the row index
      col - the column index
      Returns:
      the piece on the field, or null if the field is empty

    • isEmptyField

      public boolean isEmptyField(int i)
      Checks whether a field is empty.
      Parameters:
      i - the field index
      Returns:
      true if the field is empty

    • setField

      public void setField(int i, Piece p)
      Places a piece on the given field.
      Parameters:
      i - the field index
      p - the piece to place

    • isFull

      public boolean isFull()
      Checks whether the board is completely filled.
      Returns:
      true if all fields are occupied

    • hasRow

      public boolean hasRow()
      Checks whether a row exists that is completely filled and whose pieces share at least one common attribute.
      Returns:
      true if such a row exists

    • hasColumn

      public boolean hasColumn()
      Checks whether a column exists that is completely filled and whose pieces share at least one common attribute.
      Returns:
      true if such a column exists

    • hasDiagonal

      public boolean hasDiagonal()
      Checks whether one of the two diagonals is completely filled and whose pieces share at least one common attribute.
      Returns:
      true if such a diagonal exists

    • hasWinner

      public boolean hasWinner()
      Checks whether the board contains a winning configuration. A winning configuration exists if at least one row, column, or diagonal shares a common attribute.
      Returns:
      true if the board has a winner

    • gameOver

      public boolean gameOver()
      Checks whether the game is over. The game is over if the board has a winner or is completely full.
      Returns:
      true if the game is over

    • hasCommonAttribute

      public boolean hasCommonAttribute(Piece[] pieces)
      Checks whether the given pieces share at least one common attribute.
      Parameters:
      pieces - an array of pieces
      Returns:
      true if all pieces are non-null and share a common attribute
